title: 388. The Economics of Sports Gambling
description: What happens when tens of millions of fantasy-sports players are suddenly able to bet real money on real games? We’re about to find out. A recent Supreme Court decision has cleared the way to bring an estimated $300 billion in black-market sports betting into the light. We sort out the winners and losers.
author: editor@freakonomics.com (Freakonomics Radio + Stitcher)
